entry.title: The Police Service of Scotland (Police Cadets) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in respect of police cadets of the Police Service of Scotland.

entry.title: The Public Bodies (Abolition of the Disability Living Allowance Advisory Board) Order 2013

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Public Bodies (Abolition of the Disability Living Allowance Advisory Board) Order 2013

entry.summary: The Disability Living Allowance Advisory Board (“the Board”) was constituted under section 3(1) of the Disability Living Allowance and Disability Working Allowance Act 1991. That section was repealed by section 3(1) of, and Schedule 1 to, the Social Security (Consequential Provisions) Act 1992. At the same time, section 175 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 (“the Administration Act”) came into force. The effect of section 175 was to continue the Board in being by the same name. The founding provision for the Board is therefore now deemed to be section 175(1) of the Administration Act.

entry.title: The Rights of Passengers in Bus and Coach Transport (Exemptions) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations give effect to exemptions available to EU member States under Articles 2(4), 2(5) and 16(2) of Regulation (EU) No 181/2011 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 February 2011 concerning the rights of passengers in bus and coach transport and amending Regulation (EC) No 2006/2004 (“Regulation 181/2011”). This is directly applicable in member States.

entry.title: The Enactment of Extra-Statutory Concessions Order 2013

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Enactment of Extra-Statutory Concessions Order 2013

entry.summary: This Order is made under section 160 of the Finance Act 2008 (c. 9). It enacts an existing HMRC extra-statutory concession (“ESC”) insofar as it applied to stamp duty, and amends statutory provisions inserted by previous Enactment of Extra-Statutory Concessions Orders (S.I 2010/157 and S.I. 2011/1037).

entry.title: The Police Service of Scotland (Special Constables) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in respect of special constables of the Police Service of Scotland.

entry.title: The Police Service of Scotland (Promotion) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in relation to the eligibility and procedure for the promotion of constables of the Police Service of Scotland.

entry.title: The Police Service of Scotland Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in respect of constables of the Police Service of Scotland.

entry.title: The Employment Rights (Increase of Limits) Order (Northern Ireland) 2013
entry.summary: This Order increases, from 10th February 2013, the limits applying to certain awards of industrial tribunals, the Fair Employment Tribunal or Labour Relations Agency statutory arbitration, and other amounts payable under employment legislation, as specified in the Schedule to the Order.

entry.title: The Police Pension (Northern Ireland) (Amendment) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: The Police Pension (Northern Ireland) Regulations 2009 (“the 2009 Regulations”) provide for a defined benefits pension scheme for the members of the Police Service of Northern Ireland.

entry.title: The Immigration (Procedure for Formation of Civil Partnerships) (Amendment) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: Schedule 23 to the Civil Partnership Act 2004 makes provisions for certain procedures to be followed where a civil partnership is to be formed in the United Kingdom. Paragraph 4(1)(a) of Schedule 23 provides that where a civil partnership is to be formed in England and Wales, notice must be given to a specified registration authority. The Immigration (Procedure for formation of Civil Partnerships) Regulations 2011 specify the relevant registration authorities within England and Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.

entry.title: The Immigration (Procedure for Marriage) (Amendment) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: Section 19(2)(a) of the Asylum and Immigration (Treatment of Claimants, etc.) Act 2004 provides that where a marriage is to be solemnised in England and Wales, notices under section 27 of the Marriage Act 1949 must be given to the superintendant registrar of a registration district. The Immigration (Procedure for Marriage) Regulations 2011 specify the relevant registration districts within England and Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.

entry.title: The National Assistance (Assessment of Resources) Amendment (Scotland) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the National Assistance (Assessment of Resources) Regulations 1992 (“the principal Regulations”). The principal Regulations concern the assessment of a person’s liability to pay for accommodation provided under the Social Work (Scotland) Act 1968 (“the 1968 Act”). By virtue of section 87(3) of the 1968 Act, accommodation provided under the 1968 Act or section 25 of the Mental Health (Care and Treatment) (Scotland) Act 2003 shall be regarded as accommodation provided under Part III of the National Assistance Act 1948.

entry.title: The Council Tax Reduction Schemes (Transitional Provision) (England) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: Section 13A of the Local Government Finance Act 1992 (c.14), substituted by section 10 of the Local Government Finance Act 2012 (c.17), requires each billing authority in England to make a scheme specifying the reductions which are to apply to amounts of council tax payable by persons, or classes of person, whom the authority considers are in financial need. These Regulations make transitional provision in relation to the commencement of such schemes.

title.div: The Domiciliary Care Agencies (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2013 / Rheoliadau Asiantaethau Gofal Cartref (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2013

div.p: These Regulations amend the Domiciliary Care Agencies (Wales) Regulations 2004 (“the 2004 Regulations”) which are made under the Care Standards Act 2000.
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Asiantaethau Gofal Cartref (Cymru) 2004 (“Rheoliadau 2004”) a wneir o dan Ddeddf Safonau Gofal 2000.

entry.title: The Tobacco and Primary Medical Services (Scotland) Act 2010 (Commencement No. 3) Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order brings into force sections1, 2 and 3 of the Tobacco and Primary Medical Services (Scotland) Act 2010 (“the 2010 Act”) (article2). Sections1, 2 and 3 are brought into force for the purpose of making regulations on 26thFebruary 2013, for large shops on 29th April 2013 and for all other purposes on 6th April 2015.

entry.title: The National Assistance (Sums for Personal Requirements) (Scotland) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: Section 22(4) of the National Assistance Act 1948 as applied by section 87(3) and (4) of the Social Work (Scotland) Act 1968 (“the 1968 Act”) requires a local authority to assume in assessing a person’s liability to pay for accommodation provided under the 1968 Act or section 25 of the Mental Health (Care and Treatment) (Scotland) Act 2003 that they will need for their personal requirements such sum per week as may be prescribed by regulations.

entry.title: The National Treatment Agency (Abolition) and the Health and Social Care Act 2012 (Consequential, Transitional and Saving Provisions) Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order provides for the abolition of the National Treatment Agency (“the Agency”) and makes provision in consequence of the Health and Social Care Act 2012 (c. 7) (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Electoral Registration and Administration Act 2013 (Commencement No.1) Order 2013
entry.summary: This is the first Commencement Order bringing into force provisions of the Electoral Registration and Administration Act 2013 (c.6). It brings into force, on the day after the day on which it is made, provisions enabling regulations to be made about the disclosure of information for the purposes of electoral registration (Schedule 2) and provisions relating to the postponement of the annual canvass for 2013 to early 2014 (paragraph 9(1) and (5) to (7) of Schedule 5). It also brings into force on that day certain requirements for consultation and reports (Schedule 2 and paragraph 4(4) of Schedule 5). Sections 2(6) and 13(2) give effect to Schedules 2 and 5.

title.div: The Accounts and Audit (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2013 / Rheoliadau Cyfrifon ac Archwilio (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2013

div.p: These Regulations are made under sections 39 and 58 of the Public Audit (Wales) Act 2004 (“the 2004 Act”) and amend the Accounts and Audit (Wales) Regulations 2005 (“the 2005 Regulations”).
Caiff y Rheoliadau hyn eu gwneud o dan adrannau 39 a 58 o Ddeddf Archwilio Cyhoeddus (Cymru) 2004 (“Deddf 2004”) ac maent yn diwygio Rheoliadau Cyfrifon ac Archwilio (Cymru) 2005 (“Rheoliadau 2005”).

entry.title: The Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (Variation of Schedules A1 and 1A) (Scotland) Order 2013
entry.summary: Section 22(1)(a) of the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (“the 1981 Act”) provides for the variation of Schedules A1 and 1A to that Act by order.
